website_summaries.verdict: Responsive neutral trail runner with comfortable cushioning.
pros: Super comfortable fit in a lightweight package with plenty of traction underfoot to easily navigate the trails
The shoe is flexible for added agility off-road and has a quick-drying upper
cons: There's no rock plate for added protection

customer_reviews.title: Shoe fit adapts perfectly, but build quality...
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about fit, comfort, and anything wearabiliy related. I think the shoe is great for what it should be used for, trail hiking/running. Five 🌟 on that. But when it comes to build quality that is another story. On my second time wearing it I notice the material starting to tear!! Now I'm afraid of wearing it and having the tear expand even bigger. Two 🌟!!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Santos

customer_reviews.title: Fits too narrow/hard to put on
customer_reviews.text: As a veteran New Balance buyer, I find this show way too narrow and very difficult to put on my feet. The tongue is glued to the sides, effectively making it act like a tight sock that will tear if one isn't careful getting the shoe on the foot. I guess it would be an okay shoe IF your foot is VERY skinny. I was also disappointed to receive my shoes all laced up tightly meaning they were returned by someone else. It is always problematic buying shoes online. Don't bother with these shoes: save your money for better shoes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gordonson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SHOES BUT PRICEY
customer_reviews.text: awesome shoes ... very good arch support and comfort out of the box. however fyi the toe box is wide. i have normal to wide feet and i have trouble wearing many shoes/brands because they are too narrow ... these shoes are wide for me. another positive note ... for me the bootie construction works well because i have a tendency on trail to get pebbles etc in my shoes often. four star overall though ... lost a star for the high price point.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Hubby is glad he listened
customer_reviews.text: So my 6’2” “full bodied” husband has finally found a shoe that can take his weight and still provide adequate support (on and off the trails). I have a pair and loved mine so much that I bought him a pair. He absolutely loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Slee8391

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, poor glue.
customer_reviews.text: Within a week of wearing the shoe, the tongue ripped and the foam is showing. The neoprene sock inside the show is what the foam is glued to.... Ughhh!!!
customer_reviews.author: RUBARK

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Since the tongue is attached at both sides of the shoe. If you have a large ankle, it may be difficult to get the shoe on. Even with a 2E width it was difficult but once on it feels good. A little snug though. However they are extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wear thick socks.
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. I got these to run trails on an Army Deployment in the Middle East . Here are the pros and the cons. Pros: they look cool!, the orange makes the shoe pop. The outsole is durable and is vibram rubber, the same material found in military boots. It’s super great on out door trails, offers exceptional shock absorption and traction. Cons: some people in the review complain about the gaudy color, but there’s plenty of colors to choose from so I don’t know why they’re complaining, you will have to wear thin athletic socks or no socks since the shoe has a liner akin to an aqua sock. Other than that it’s a solid shoe and would rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Andres

customer_reviews.title: super nice trail running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Outter shell of this shoe is made with water proof coating with laser slice slit so heat and moisture will not be trapped inside. Inner liner of the shoe is made with elastic fabric material fits like a sock. However, this design makes the inner shoe feeling more empty so the size will run large by half to one size. Overall it's a very nice running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Veggiesweat

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: They are kind of hard to put on but once you get past that the tongue pulls apart as it's just glued on. I was expecting more at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes; Awesome color; Awesome support
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt one of my favorite hiking shoes. Love the color, love the comfort. Fits my size 13 foot just perfectly. I can wear these for hours on end without concern, and they do a great job of keeping moisture out! They sort of "slip on" over your foot and then you can lace them up for extra support/secure. Definitely worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stinnett

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable fit however one of my first few runs revealed a design flaw in my opinion. Seems I hit a stick with my foot and the rubbery material around it tore. I can see how this could happen again and again. I've had them a little over 2 weeks. Kind of bummed about it because I doubt I can return them as I've used them several times. Can't be a trail running shoe if they are torn to shreds!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grip and rip.
customer_reviews.text: Love the grip on dirt/mud trails. Worked well for me in a Sparatan Sprint Race. The size length wise was a little larger than I would of liked but due to poor planning on my behalf I didn't have time to return for a half size smaller. Width is great, I wish more trail shoes came in wide. The sock inside the shoe makes for more warmth than desired but I understsnd that this is how your feet remain dry from outside the shoe elements.
customer_reviews.author: Daymaker

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe I ever wore
customer_reviews.text: Shoe has an inner bootie that you slip your foot thru. Contrary to others, found very good at keep on your ankle and easy to put on. Running is a dream in these. Imagine walking on a memory foam mattress. Really, unbelievably comfortable. Soft.
customer_reviews.author: Photog 73

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoes & keeps gravel out
customer_reviews.text: These are great trail running shoes with grippy soles and comfortable on terrain. It runs true to size. I got the D width which is plenty wide for my broad feet. The upper material is flexible & has a sock like fit at the ankles which keeps gravel out, especially the larger bits. So less stopping to get the stones out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kit

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for running on multiple surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fantastic, they fit exactly as expected. Comfortable and light weight, the soles are cushioned very well feels like running on a cloud. They have great grip as well, they stick to wet pavement like glue. I’ve only had them about a month at this point so durability is still an unknown but they feel like they’ll last.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest B.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe and service.
customer_reviews.text: High quality trail shoe. Having feet trouble, had to go up 1 full size to get proper fit. Thanks Amazon for the generous shoe ordering policy. Very happy with these shoes and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: bigb

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: The build-in stocking was tight for my feet. However, it was easier to wear with a shoe-horn guiding my feet through. Good shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Functional but didnt last long
customer_reviews.text: These shoes last all of two hikes before getting ripped apart by the trail. The shoe is covered in a plastic layer that rips easily, leaving a mesh underneath. The rubber sole is nice, and the shoe is comfortable overall, but they did not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe for the road or the trail.
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable. Love the elastic around the ankle (hated getting rocks in my shoes while running). I generally run on a gravel path and these so far have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Wild-Fan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for 10k to half marathon on trail runs.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is perfect. The built in sock really keeps debris out while running on trails. The breathability also is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have 30+ pairs of shoes. I have Mizuno, Brooks, Nike, Adidas, Asics, Diadora and New Balance. These are the most comfortable pair I currently own.
customer_reviews.author: realblue24

customer_reviews.title: Like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit perfectly! Love the sock type top! Use for softball and the shoes work wonderfully
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not fix as expected.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits my foot as far as size, but it cuts into my Achilles tendon. Did not fit as I expected considering I have purchased the same brand of shoes before. I will be returning. I did like the look of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Rissa

customer_reviews.title: "wide" is not the same as 2EE
customer_reviews.text: NB claim that "wide" = 2EE is not accurate. The "wide" shoe doesn't fit like 2EE did.
customer_reviews.author: William F.

customer_reviews.title: and they are perfect. Super comfortable and perfect for coaching soccer
customer_reviews.text: Received my shoes in 1 day, and they are perfect. Super comfortable and perfect for coaching soccer, shopping, and trail running. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Love

customer_reviews.title: Good: Performed as hoped and expected
customer_reviews.text: Trail experience: This shoe is the perfect compliment to alternate days in the trails with the Summit Unknown by NB. The shoe performed good in mud and loose gravel. Absorbed impact and distributed power in kick just as I would have hoped. The shoe created a fair balance between cushion and responsiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Madison

customer_reviews.title: Was comforable
customer_reviews.text: 2/18/2019 - After wearing 6 months I has to stop wearing them. They started hurt my feet. I have wore New Balance past several years and finally found a pair that I can wear all day and my feet are not hurt. I feel like I am walking on foam. Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product and great service!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes and probably great for running, but not what I expected. I returned with absolutely no issues and refund was done promptly!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the Vibran soles, they really grip the ground nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jon F.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size sent. Cheap material.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 9.5 regular and 9.5 wide but only received both regular. Tight fitting and material seemed to be cheap plastic rubber material. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Madame Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Solid, light, durable trail running/hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Colorful, light, sturdy New BALNCE for desert hiking & running in Saguaro National Park, Arizona. NB always fits (12.5Mens) this larger, heavier fitness enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Leonard

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My husband says these are the most comfortable shoe he has ever worn. He want to order several more.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable trail running shoe I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable trail running shoe I have purchased. I am a big guy and run trails that are very rocky. I have purchased Merril's, Saucony and Salomon in the last 6 months and these are by far the best shoe for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and style
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Fit great. So comfortable. No tiredness/aches in my feet during long hikes. And look really awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: These were supposed to be a wide width shoe. They are not, if you like a wide comfy shoe these are not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, durable, perfect fitting trail shoe!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT trail shoe! Light, with durable VIBRAM sole. Nothing like NEW BALNCE for odd fit, fitness guys. 12.5 almost impossible to find in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. My only complaint is the tongue has a foamand plastic strip that comes loose very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - but comfortable while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: Top covered started to rip a fret about 30 miles and after 50 completely ruined. Very comfortable but no quality
customer_reviews.author: Cory Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits a bit small but after about 30 miles I dont even notice anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit as a lifestyle sneaker. Too uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These are supposed to have the "foam" soles. NOT the same as the 574 Sport extra foam. I mean they are orange so that's cool. OTT... not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: New Balance feel...in a trail runner
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet. It’s tough to find trail runners wide enough. These feel absolutely great. Great traction on wet pavement also. The sock liner is really nice also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actual shoe looks different than photo
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are not what I expected but comfortable. I thought they were a mesh material like Sketchers’ brand. The shoes are a plastic / cheap looking material. And these are a lot more florescent than the picture portrays. You could spot me from a mile away with these on. Buyer beware here!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Lewis

customer_reviews.title: 2 stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were a little tighter than expected. I can only wear them without socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Hierro v3 Fresh Foam Trail Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Distance meets design in the new fresh foam hierro V3. A plush underfoot ride married to aggressive traction yields a whole new experience on the trails.
